isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - MANUAL AND AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION

step1.para: If new ring gear is required, heat the new ring gear evenly until the gear expands enough to slip onto the flywheel. Make sure the gear is sealed properly against the shoulder. Do not heat any portion of the gear to a temperature higher than 500° F (278° C). If this limit is exceeded, the hardness will be removed from the ring gear teeth.
Install the rear cover with rear oil seal installed (as described earlier in this section) as follows:

important.para: SEAL PROTECTOR SHOWN IN FIGURE IS FOR STANDARD SIZE REAR OIL SEAL INSTALLATION. WHEN INSTALLING OPTIONAL OVERSIZED REAR OIL SEAL, USE PROTECTOR INCLUDED IN WEAR SLEEVE PACKAGE (P/N 1 807 788 C92). REFER TO INSTRUCTIONS INCLUDED WITH WEAR SLEEVE PACKAGE.

step2.para:
Apply a thin coat of Aviation Permatext #3 to crankcase cover gasket surface as shown in Figure 6.50
.
Install rear cover gasket. Repeat above application of sealant on gasket. DO NOT ALLOW PERMATEX TO GET ON CRANKSHAFT OIL SEAL FLANGE.

important.para: DO NOT GET ANY AVIATION PERMATEX™ #3 SEALANT ON THE SEAL LIP.

step2.para: With appropriate seal protector installed over crankshaft flange to protect the seal lip, coat the seal lip with a thin film of clean engine oil.

Install rear cover and seal assembly over seal protector as shown in Figure 6.51
. Remove seal protector after rear cover and seal assembly installation. Tighten all bolts to standard torque.

note.para: Apply an additional 1/4 in. bead of R.T.V. sealant in 2 places as shown in Figure 6.50, prior to rear cover and seal installation.
Apply R.T.V. sealant (Dow 732 or GE Silmate 1473) to oil pan surface as follows:

step2.para: If Oil Pan is Removed:
1/8 in. dia. bead for side rails as shown in Figure 6.63.

1/4 in. dia. bead for corners, front and rear ends as shown in Figure 6.63
. Corners have double bead.
If Oil Pan is Not Removed:

1/4 in. dia. bead for front corners as shown in Figure 6.50
.

important.para: ASSEMBLE PARTS WITHIN 10 MINUTES OF APPLICATION OF RTV COMPONENTS.

step1.para:
With the rear cover and seal assembly in place check seal run-out as follows ( Figure 6.52
):

step2.para: Position a magnetic base dial indicator on the end of the crankshaft flange.
Place the indicator against the rear surface of the seal body at the 12 o'clock position. Remove crankshaft end play by pushing (or pulling) against the crankshaft and "zero" the dial indicator.
Bar the engine over and take a reading at four (4) points, approximately 90° apart.
Crankshaft seal run-out should not exceed specified run-out.

important.para: NEVER TAKE AN INDICATOR READING WITH THE INDICATOR PROBE RESTING ON LETTERS OR NUMBERS WHICH APPEAR ON THE REAR SURFACE OF THE SEAL.

step1.para: If rear crankshaft oil seal run-out exceeds specifications, adjust the seal as follows: (Refer to Figure 6.56.) (Note location of seal which protrudes out the farthest.)

step2.para: It is recommended that a pressing plate be fabricated as specified in Figure 6.52 and used in conjunction with an SAE No. 16 woodruff key, 3/8 in. cap screw and washer as follows:

step3.para: Gently tighten the bolt against the seal to depress the area of the seal which exceeds the run-out specification.
After adjustment, measure rear crankshaft seal run-out to assure specified run-out.

step1.para:
Install the flywheel housing (if removed), using the six mounting bolts and hardened washers. Refer to Figure 6.55
. Tighten to standard torque.
Manual Transmissions:Apply Lock N' Sealant (P/N 577 588 C1) to all nine mounting bolts and tighten to specified torque.

step2.para: Engine Ser. No.s' 848 166 and Below: If reinstalling original mounting bolts apply Lock N' Sealant (P/N 577 588 C1) to all nine mounting bolts and tighten to specified torque.
If new mounting bolts are being installed refer to Step b below.
All Engines w/Automatic Transmissions:When installing new flywheel mounting bolts for the first time, check mounting bolt thread color. Six to eight threads should be silver color.
This silver color is a pre-applied sealant and DOES NOT require the application of additional sealant to the threads.
However, each time mounting bolt is removed to service flywheel apply Lock N' Sealant (P/N 577 588 C1) to the clean bolt threads before reinstalling bolt and tighten to specified torque.

step1.para: With the flywheel installed on the crankshaft, check flywheel face and ring gear run-out as follows:

step2.para:
flywheel face run-out, install a dial indicator so the indicator point bears against the flywheel face, one inch in from the edge of the flywheel, Figure 6.56
. For checking ring gear run-out, install the dial indicator point on the face of the ring gear adjacent to the gear teeth. Refer to Figure 6.57
.
Push flywheel forward prior to turning the flywheel, so crankshaft "end play" will not be indicated as flywheel run-out.
Set the dial indicator to zero. Turn the flywheel one complete revolution while observing the total indicator run-out (T.I.R.).
If flywheel face T.I.R. exceeds specifications, remove flywheel and check for burrs between the flywheel and face of the crankshaft mounting flange. Remove burrs as required.
If no burrs exist, recheck the crankshaft flange run-out, using a dial indicator.
If run-out is excessive, replace the crankshaft.
If the crankshaft flange run-out is within specifications, resurface (manual transmission only) or replace the flywheel as required.
If ring gear T.I.R. exceeds specifications, check ring gear installation. Reheat the gear evenly until it expands enough to be properly seated on the flywheel shoulder.
Recheck run-out; if not within specifications, replace the flywheel and ring gear assembly.

note.para: Flywheel housing pilot bore concentricity and flywheel housing face run-out should be checked to ensure proper engine to transmission alignment.

step1.para: Check flywheel housing bore concentricity as follows:

step2.para:
Attach a magnetic base dial indicator to the flywheel and place the indicator tip against the flywheel housing pilot bore. Refer to Figure 6.58
.
"Zero" the dial indicator.
Rotate the crankshaft slowly and record the total indicator variation. Refer to "SPECIFICATIONS". for housing bore concentricity tolerance.

step1.para: Check flywheel housing face run-out as follows:

step2.para:
Attach a dial indicator to the flywheel and place the indicator tip against the flywheel housing face. Refer to Figure 6.59
.
Measure at four points, 90° apart, for total face variation.

important.para: "ZERO" THE CRANKSHAFT END PLAY BY PUSHING THE CRANKSHAFT IN THE SAME DIRECTION FOR ALL MEASUREMENTS.

step1.para: Engines with automatic transmissions must have the reinforcement ring and flex plate installed after the flywheel passes inspection.
